DOC.brief_summary: This study assess efficacy safety indacaterol ( 150 µg daily [ od ] ) combine tiotropium ( 18 µg od ) versus tiotropium ( 18 µg od ) treatment alone patient chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Indacaterol Plus Tiotropium Versus Tiotropium Alone Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) ( moderatetosevere classify Global Initiative Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease ( GOLD ) Guidelines , 2007 ) : Smoking history least 10 packyears Postbronchodilator force expiratory volume 1 second ( FEV1 ) ≤ 65 % ≥ 30 % predict normal value Postbronchodilator FEV1/FVC ( force vital capacity ) < 70 % Patients receive systemic corticosteroid and/or antibiotic and/or hospitalize COPD exacerbation 6 week prior screen runin period Patients respiratory tract infection within 6 week prior screen Patients concomitant pulmonary disease Patients history asthma Patients diabetes Type I uncontrolled diabetes Type II Any patient lung cancer history lung cancer Patients history certain cardiovascular comorbid condition Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion apply study .
